column1: There was a terrible hubbub in the henhouse. The Rooster squalled so loudly that he waked up every hen in the place. And when they heard him crying that a skunk had knocked him off his roost they were as frightened as he was
column2: and set up a wild cackle. All but Henrietta Hen! She knew there was no skunk there."Don't be a goose—er—don't be a gander!" she hissed to the Rooster. "I'm the one that bumped into you."The Rooster quickly came to his senses."Don't be alarmed
column3: ladies!" he called to the flock. "There's no danger. There's been a slight mistake." He pretended that he hadn't been scared. But he had been. And now he was somewhat uneasy about Henrietta Hen. He feared he was in for a scolding from her."If you had answered me when I spoke to you I wouldn't have left my perch in the dark
column4: she told the Rooster severely. When I moved to your perch to see what was the matter I blundered into you. And then you thought I was a skunk! You owe me an apology
